newsitem.title: USA: Clinton, Netanyahu begin Mideast crisis summit.
newsitem.headline: Clinton, Netanyahu begin Mideast crisis summit.

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met at the White House on Tuesday to begin a Middle East crisis summit.

The Israeli leader, who said en route to Washington that he would press for quick resumption of Israeli-Palestinian peace negotiations, was scheduled to talk with Clinton for about 30 minutes in the first of a two-day series of bilateral and group meetings. Palestinian President Yasser Arafat was due to follow Netanyahu in a private talk with Clinton.
Jordan's King Hussein, who had a pre-summit meeting with Clinton on Monday night, was also taking part and would join the other three at a group meeting planned for Tuesday afternoon.
The summit was prompted by an eruption of violence last week in the Gaza Strip and West Bank that has threatened to destroy ongoing Isaeli-Palestinian peace negotiations.
